intro: Centaurea apiculata, commonly known as the slender centaury, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 centimeters and features narrow, grass-like leaves. Its flowers are usually blue to purple in color, with a distinctive central yellow disk. Centaurea apiculata is often found in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes.
